items.title: Fixed a few typos.

items.content_html:
Description

Added a note about cursor behavior on iPadOS. iPad supports pointer and text only, other values do not change an appearance of the pointer.

Motivation

This information may be useful for people who rely on cursor property only when designing a hover state of elements.

Additional details

Official video from Apple demonstrating the new cursor: https://youtu.be/78m5qtJI5Nk
items.title: Add a note about `cursor` behavior on iPadOS

items.content_html:
Description

This PR makes two minor changes to the tabs/executeScript and scripting/executeScript webextensions API docs.

  1. fix issue note in scripting/executescript
  2. Mention special cases where executeScript does not work even with host permissions: reader view, view-source, and PDF viewer pages.

Motivation

Document current special case behavior, that executeScript will not function on reader view, view-source, and PDF viewer pages, even with host permissions allowed.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: WebExtensions: note special cases for `executeScript`

items.content_html:
push() can validly be called with any number of arguments including zero, provided that the total number of elements after the push operation completes does not exceed (2**53) - 1.

Description

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Added case of pushing 0 elements and gave limit

items.content_html:
Description

This is a follow up to "See also" guidelines pull request #25191.

This pull request applies the guidelines to a few existing "See also" sections, as were discussed as examples in the discussion. One of the examples is already covered in the previous pull request: /en-us/web/css/@layer/index.md

As a result of the feedback in #25191, there are slight differences from what was originally proposed and discussed. The guidelines have been updated in #25191.

In general, the following structure is being followed:

<link text>: description phrase(no punctuation)

The description phrase is optional. The list item should begin with the link text. Keeping all link texts in a list at the beginning will help to easily and quickly scan the list.
items.title: docs(fix): Apply See also guidelines as examples

  • I updated SVGAnimatedLength to match the modern structure

Changes:

  • New page for <hue> as data type with examples
    • Adds compat links for functional notation that can use <hue> as a single value
  • color-mix() page:
    • examples how to use hue-interpolation-method
    • updates to syntax section
  • minor clean up to /web/css/color_value/index.md to make intro section a little shorter for readability.

Fixes mdn/mdn#358
items.title: docs(CSS): add examples of hue interpolation methods, add hue page

items.content_html:
The demo that was added is a useful way to see how arcTo() works. However, the code is more related to the user interactions than arcTo(), so it was hidden using the methods described at https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/MDN/Writing_guidelines/Page_structures/Code_examples. So the HTML should be hidden, but it appears in the preview. Perhaps this is a bug in the previewer?

Description

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Added arcTo() details and demo

Additional details

N/A

Related issues and pull requests

items.title: Clarify relationship between readystate=interactive and DOMContentLoaded

items.content_html:
Description

Create docs for SVGClipPathElement.clipPathUnits and SVGClipPathElement.transform

Motivation

This is part of openwebdocs/project#152

Additional details

You fall into at least one rabbit hole when you touch the SVG docs. In this case, I had to:

  • Fix SVGClipPathElement that was incomplete.
  • Fix SVGUnitTypes that was old school.
  • Fix SVGAnimatedEnumeration that was even older school.
  • Add SVGAnimatedEnumeration.baseVal and animVal.

Having practical examples for the latest was not trivial (as animated enumeration is not very interesting to demonstrate).

I didn't fall further into the rabbit hole as I limited myself to what was needed to avoid flaws in these files.

Related issues and pull requests

None.
items.title: Document SVGClipPathElement.(clipPathUnits|transform)

items.content_html:
Description

This PR is part of a multi-PR series that aims to document the WebGPU API. The interfaces documented in this PR are:

  • GPUCommandBuffer (done)
  • GPUCommandEncoder (done)
  • GPUComputePassEncoder
  • GPUQueue(done)
  • GPURenderBundle
  • GPURenderBundleEncoder
  • GPURenderPassEncoder

Note that the main PR for this series is #24202 — that one must be merged first, before this one! after that one is merged, main should be merged into this PR, and the documentation integrity must be checked (e.g. do all the links work) before merging.

You can see full details of the additions expected in the WebGPU docs in my research document.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: WebGPU PR #5 — Interfaces for handling command encoding and submission

items.content_html:
Part of openwebdocs/project#152

  1. HTMLElement.style did not match the page's modern style, and the example was wrong.
  2. SVGElement.style was missing. Added.
  3. The page linked to CSS Properties Reference was removed. The new page doesn't have the information to convert a CSS property name into a JS identifier, so I added it. (in both pages)

I tested both examples via a temporary {{EmbedLiveSample}} macro. I didn't keep it: the interesting part is on the console anyway (and very long).

In the future, there may be a MathMLElement.style.
items.title: Update documentation for {HTML,SVG}Element.style

items.content_html:
Description

The comment in the code example mentioned only "1" or "0" as possible return values, although "unspecified" is also possible.

Motivation

The code example might trick readers into thinking that only those two values can be returned.
items.title: Update comment in `navigator.doNotTrack` example
